Why does Lopetegui always wear sunglasses in training?


Real Madrid’s coach has a minor problem with his vision which means he has to protect his eyes from the sun’s ultraviolet rays.

It’s a question which many madridistas have asked: “Why does Lopetegui always wear wraparound sunglasses during Real Madrid’s training sessions?”. The Madrid coach is never seen without his prescription sunglasses when the sun is out and while his look might make him appear like one of the Men in Black, it’s actually due to a minor problem with his vision. For medical reasons, he needs to protect his eyes from the sun’s UVA rays.

Gotta wear shades

For Sergio Ramos, Isco and the rest of Madrid’s Spanish internationals, it’s nothing new - Lopetegui also wore his sunglasses during his time with the national team and is used to explaining why he has to wear them to new players. In Miami, he is at high risk of exposure to UVA, especially in July – even when it rains. That’s why it was a bit surprising to see Lopetegui, soaking wet but still with his sunglasses on while it poured down during a thunderstorm in Sunday’s session, the squad’s first in Miami.

Real Madrid's Lopetegui deletes Twitter, Instagram accounts

New Real boss Julen Lopetegui surprised his social-media followers by suddenly deleting his accounts following his first game in charge.

New Real Madrid head coach Julen Lopetegui has opted to delete his social-media accounts following his first match in charge of the LaLiga giants.

Real Madrid coach wants to avoid distractions

AS understands that the former Spain boss, who was appointed at the Bernabéu in June, wants to be completely focused on Real's pre-season preparations and avoid any distractions.

After his side's 2-1 defeat to Manchester United in the International Champions Cup on Tuesday, Lopetegui today cancelled his profiles on Twitter - on which he had just over 140,000 followers - and Instagram.

Had used social media to show Benzema support

Though not a prolific poster, the 51-year-old had been known to make his presence felt on social media from time to time.

In July, for example, he published a photo of himself with Real striker Karim Benzema, in what was seen as a public show of support for the oft-criticised Frenchman.

Real Madrid face race against time to tie up Courtois deal

The Premier League market closes on August 9 and if Chelsea do not find a replacement the Belgium stopper will remain at Stamford Bridge.

Real Madrid’s pursuit of Chelsea keeper Thibaut Courtois is entering a crucial phase with the Stamford Bridge board combing the market for a replacement and the Premier League transfer window set to close at 18:00 on August 9.

https://en.as.com/en/2018/08/02/football/1533201449_681320.html

Benzema assumes leadership role and acts as Vinicius' godfather


The departure of Cristiano Ronaldo means that Karim Benzema is now the third captain at Real Madrid, with only Sergio Ramos and Marcelo ahead of him in the squad hierarchy.

The Frenchman has taken this role seriously and has acted as a leader during the first 15 days of pre-season, becoming a role model for the younger members of the squad.

One of those young players is Vinicius Junior, who Benzema has taken under his wing.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/08/02/5b62d83fe2704e8fac8b4680.html

Asensio and Lucas Vazquez to De Gea: Karius, Karius!

David de Gea came up against a number of his Spain teammates when Manchester United took on Real Madrid in the International Champions Cup, including Marco Asensio and Lucas Vazquez.

The two Real Madrid players greeted the goalkeeper in the tunnel of the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami and were caught joking with him on camera.

"Karius, Karius!" they were seen shouting, in footage from Gol's 'El Golazo' programme.

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/08/02/5b62c259e2704e4f838b464d.html

Lopetegui to his players: Put some feeling into it, for f**k's sake!

Real Madrid are continuing to prepare for the new season during their tour of the United States and Julen Lopetegui has his players working hard during training.

The coach has been urging his players on during the sessions, calling for intensity.

"Some quality, some quickness," he is seen saying in a video of one session.

"Put some feeling into it, for f**k's sake!"

http://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2018/08/02/5b62e646e2704ea2748b4695.html

Fulham join pursuit of Theo Hernandez

Theo Hernandez is likely to leave Real Madrid this summer and while Real Sociedad appeared to be the most likely destination for the full-back, Premier League side Fulham are now attempting to lure him to London.

Fulham are willing to pay 2 million euros for a season's loan while also paying the entirety of the player's wages, which is not something that Real Sociedad are currently offering.

Real Madrid just as good without Ronaldo - Barcelona's Ter Stegen

Marc-André ter Stegen is determined not to underestimate Real Madrid after they lost Cristiano Ronaldo to Juventus.

"I think they have an amazing team, like every year, just like us," he said. "It'll be equally difficult to play against them with or without Ronaldo.

"You have to understand that this is a player who made the difference in a lot of games, but we focus ourselves on our game and we know that, if we're confident, we have the chance to do it all."

Sergio Ramos' delayed return from holiday is uncomfortable for some at Real Madrid

Real Madrid allowed captain Sergio Ramos to extend his summer break for the second year in a row, a decision that not all at Los Blancos are comfortable with.

While the defender had the permission of the coaching staff, the differential treatment hasn't gone down well in some sectors of the club.
Ramos' Spain teammates Isco, Marco Asensio, Lucas Vazquez and Nacho returned from their holidays on July 25 and July 26, while Dani Carvajal joined up with the squad on July 29.
Yet he didn't return to work until August 1, the day after the match against Manchester United.

The Croatian is likely to be left out for the European Supercup final. But his omisson him will have nothing to do with rumours circulating about his future ovet the past few days.

Luka Modric will finally return to training on Wednesday, as was scheduled after his participation in the World Cup final with Croatia on 15 July.
